did.unittitle: University of Michigan Retirees Association records

archdesc.bioghist: Founded in March 1953, the University Retirees Association (formerly the Annuitants Association) was established to promote the individual and collective interests of annuitants and to afford the advantages of organized programs of studies and activities, including informing annuitants of their rights and privileges; investigating need readjustments of annuity payments; advising prospective annuitants regarding ways of meeting the requirements for social security benefits;
archdesc.scopecontent: Record volumes include executive committee agenda and minutes, general meeting agenda and minutes, and correspondence. Also included are files of Big 11 Retirees Association that consist of comparisons of cost of living vs. income for retirees, compilations of public resources for retirees, and minutes of the Big 11 Conference.
